intro: Apteranthes burchardii subsp. maura, commonly known as the Maura bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that typically range in color from white to pale blue. The plant belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in rocky and arid environments. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique floral display.
